title: Sol 4225: Sliding Down Horsetail Falls
summary: Earth planning date: Monday, June 24, 2024 This will be an important week for chemistry on our latest drill sample “Mammoth Lakes 2.”  Curiosity’s primary goal today was a preconditioning of the SAM instrument in preparation for its chemical analysis. Due to the large amounts of power required by SAM, today’s science block was limited […]

title: Open Call to New York-based Artists to Create Collaborative NASA Mural
summary: NASA and the Hudson Square Business Improvement District are launching an open call to New York-based artists and artist teams to design and install a large-scale, space-themed neighborhood mural. The NASA x Hudson Square partnership was developed to inspire the surrounding Manhattan Hudson Square community by showcasing NASA’s work and missions. Artists are encouraged to […]

title: NASA's Next Generation Spacesuit Program Faces Setback as Collins Aerospace Backs Out
summary: NASA's Next Generation Spacesuit Program Faces Setback as Collins Aerospace Backs Out

title: NASA’s commercial spacesuit program just hit a major snag
summary: "Unfortunately Collins has been significantly behind schedule."

title: Unity in Orbit: Astronauts Soar with Pride Aboard Station
summary: A powerful symbol of pride waved high above Earth aboard the International Space Station in December 2021, reflecting NASA’s commitment to a collaborative and inclusive environment in human spaceflight. The Pride flag was unveiled by NASA astronauts to celebrate our identities and unite in our commitment to equality and acceptance for all individuals.  At NASA’s […]

title: Latitude Awarded €15M in New France 2030 Funding
summary: French rocket builder Latitude has been awarded €15 million by the French government to fund two development projects. Latitude is developing a two-stage rocket called Zephyr that will be powered by the company’s in-house developed Navier engines. The rocket is designed to initially be capable of delivering payloads of up to 100 kilograms to low […]

title: Six Adapters for Crewed Artemis Flights Tested, Built at NASA Marshall
summary: As a child learning about basic engineering, you probably tried and failed to join a square-shaped toy with a circular-shaped toy: you needed a third shape to act as an adapter and connect them both together. On a much larger scale, integration of NASA’s powerful SLS (Space Launch System) rocket and the Orion spacecraft for […]

title: Space Force seeks bids for ‘Resilient GPS’ satellite program
summary: R-GPS is a new procurement of small satellites to augment the existing GPS constellation

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch final NASA, NOAA GOES weather satellite on Falcon Heavy rocket
summary: The geostationary orbital satellite is the fourth and final in the Geostationary Operational Environmental Satellites-R (GOES-R) series. Liftoff is set for the opening of a two-hour window at 5:16 p.m. EDT (2116 UTC).

title: NASA Infrared Detector Technical Interchange
summary: When/Where August 27-28, 2024NASA Jet Propulsion Laboratory in Pasadena, CA Who may attend? Invited participants from the NASA Centers, NASA HQ, and the broader community of IR technology developers and stakeholders.
